newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Thorn Apple rated buy.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Thorn Apple rated buy.

text.p: Dain Bosworth analyst Bonnie Wittenburg said Tuesday she began coverage of pork processor Thorn Apple Valley Inc with a buy rating.
-- "We believe a significant turnaround is underway at Thorn Apple Valley...," Wittenburg said in a report.
-- She added she expects earnings to grow from a "slight loss" in fiscal 1997 on a LIFO-adjusted basis to a profit of $1.05 a share in fiscal 1998 and $2.50 in fiscal 1999.
-- Thorn Apple shares were up 3/8 at 18.

-- In a report, Wittenburg said Thorn Apple was hit severely in fiscal 1996 when it made a substantial acquisition and undertook "huge" capital expenditures to upgrade and build facilities, at a time when industry pork margins suffered.

-- "Now Thorn Apple Valley is the largest and most efficient that it has ever been; its capital spending needs are modest, margins are improving; debt is being reduced, interest rates have come down, and cash flow is improving dramatically," Wittenburg said.

-- She added Thorn Apple is changing from being heavily dependent on private label and fresh pork commodity products to deriving a majority of its sales and earnings from higher margin proprietary branded products.
